alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 2:55AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Harlan and east central Bell Counties through 330 AM EDT... At 254 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Molus, or 10 miles west of Harlan, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch diameter hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wallins Creek and Pathfork around 300 AM EDT. Kentenia around 305 AM EDT. Liggett, Teetersville, Elcomb and White Star around 310 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Harlan, Mary Alice, Peepace Store, Martins Fork, Hensley Store, Grays Knob, Chevrolet, Tway, Martins Fork Lake, Smith, Three Point, Bobs Creek and Lenarve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
